title: Polenta Sandwiches
introduction: These delightful polenta sandwiches, or Panini di Polenta, can be served as appetizers or as a side dish. They boast a perfect blend of creamy gorgonzola nestled between slices of firm polenta, offering a comforting and flavorful bite. For a creative presentation, consider using cookie or biscuit cutters to shape the polenta.
ingredients: 1 recipe (about 5 cups) Polenta, made without butter

instructions.step: Prepare the polenta. As soon as the polenta is cooked, spread it with a rubber spatula to about a 1⁄2-inch thickness on a large baking sheet. Cover and chill until firm, at least 1 hour and up to 3 days, before using.
Place a rack in the center of the oven. Preheat the oven to 400°F. Butter a large baking sheet.

Cut the polenta into 16 squares. Place half the polenta slices on the cookie sheet. Place the gorgonzola slices on top of them. Top with the remaining polenta, pressing down lightly on the sandwiches.
Brush the tops with the butter. Sprinkle with the Parmigiano. Bake 10 to 15 minutes or until the cheese is just melted. Serve hot.
